content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) producing {'iron-plate': 43} with warning: no ingredients to smelt  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0) with warnings: out of fuel; output blocked by item on the ground  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) with warning: out of fuel; with pickup at (–15.5, –49.5) and drop at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5) holding {'iron-ore': 146}  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) with status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS; with pickup at (–15.5, –47.5) and drop at (–13.5, –47.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5) with warning: not receiving electricity  
– Sink Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) with warning: not connected to power network; with pickup at (–13.5, –46.5) and drop at (–13.5, –44.5)  
– BeltGroup connecting Fast Inserter drop at (–11.5, –49.5) to Sink Inserter pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) with warning: no ingredients to smelt

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5) with lab_input: {'automation-science-pack': 23}  
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5) (WORKING)  
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) (WORKING) connected to the Boiler  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) with warnings: out of fuel; no input liquid; no fluid present in connections  
– Generator (Steam Engine) at (2.5, 27.5) with warnings: no input liquid; no fluid present in connections  
  Note: The fluid connection between the Boiler and Steam Engine remains unresolved due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5).

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5) with warnings: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate (1)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
– Distributed Small Electric Poles forming the established electricity network

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189393) spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189398) at approximately (8.5, 5.5) with 2 pipe segments  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189399) at approximately (10.5, 4.5) with multiple segments  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189404) linking offshore pump at (–9.5, 24.5) with a series of pipes toward the Boiler  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189407) at (2.5, 9.5) with a short chain of connections  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189408) at (10.5, 9.5) with secondary pipe routing  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189414) at (1.5, 11.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189429) at (–1.5, 17.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189430) at (0.5, 17.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189432) at (6.5, 16.5)  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189437) at (–1.5, 21.5) – potential congestion point  
– PipeGroup (fluid_system=189446) at (4.5, 25.5) with several pipe segments

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting outputs of mining and inserter setups  
– Electricity network established via Distributed Small Electric Poles and multiple ElectricityGroups (e.g., poles at [–10.5, –49.5], [–12.5, –48.5], [–12.5, –50.5], among others)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion and Connection Conflicts
  – Persistent congestion near the Boiler’s lower connection at (2.5, 21.5) prevents establishing a proper fluid link between the Boiler and the Steam Engine.  
  – The presence of numerous pipe groups and interfering entities leads to collisions even when trying candidate directions (RIGHT, UP, LEFT, DOWN) with varied spacings.  
  – Mitigation: Reconfigure or relocate obstructing pipe groups, consider upgrading to underground pipelines or pipe-to-ground modules, and reroute the connection to a less congested region.

• Fuel, Resource, and Power Supply Issues
  – Warnings such as “no ingredients to smelt”, out-of-fuel alerts, missing resources (e.g., insufficient iron-plate for pipe production), and lack of electrical connectivity for inserters and assembling machines indicate supply gaps.
  – Mitigation: Monitor and replenish fuels and raw materials consistently, and expand the power grid to cover all production facilities.

• Entity Placement and Collision Conflicts
  – Overlapping placements and blocked outputs (as observed with mining drills and inserters) suggest tile occupation conflicts.
  – Mitigation: Verify the target tile’s availability and ensure proper spacing before placement to avoid collisions.
